page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW OF THE AREA
page.content: Most of the block is agricultural land but there are parts of three villages- Billingborough, Horbling and Threekingham. The major crops are cereals because the land is flat and open and working it is easy. There is little wooded land and no major rivers or lakes.The land drains into the dykes constructed many years ago when the land was reclaimed. Billingborough is the largest village providing the main shops and services, schools and employment.Residents of the hamlets of Stow and Birthorpe travel to Billingborough to take advantage of the services.There are several buildings of interest in Billingborough and recently a museum opened in the village.The area has no major road networks.The atmosphere of the block is that of a quiet rural area.
